verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
ity anujñāpya dāśārhaṁ
dhṛtarāṣṭraṁ yudhiṣṭhiram
rājarṣe svāśramān gantuṁ
munayo dadhire manaḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; iti—thus speaking; anujñāpya—taking permission to leave; dāśārham—of Lord Kṛṣṇa, the descendant of Mahārāja Daśārha; dhṛtarāṣṭram—of Dhṛtarāṣṭra; yudhiṣṭhiram—of Yudhiṣṭhira; rāja—among kings; ṛṣe—O sage; sva—their own; āśramān—to the hermitages; gantum—to going; munayaḥ—the sages; dadhire—turned; manaḥ—their minds.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Having thus spoken, O wise king, the sages then took leave of Lord Dāśārha, Dhṛtarāṣṭra and Yudhiṣṭhira and prepared to depart for their āśramas.
